chunks.text: Near Kuala Lumpur, these graceful buildings have been constructed by the University of Malaya.
Offering courses in law, engineering, science and the arts, the new university is catering to Malaya's need for higher education.
Today, New Zealand Prime Minister, Mr. Nash, opens a new building that will house the Faculty of Agriculture.

With a grant of 250,000 pounds made by New Zealand under the Colombo plan, Malaya erected the building in six months. Mr. Nash declares the faculty open, marking the end of a successful Colombo plan project.
Under the charge of New Zealander, Professor Maxwell Davies, students will take courses in all aspects of agricultural science.
The new faculty of agriculture buildings stands as another example of economic cooperation
and the happy relations enjoyed between New Zealand and the Federation of Malaya.
The Auckland Junior Chamber of Commerce gives a weekend at the chateau to 50 children.
Everything's provided, accommodation, transport and skis, even a clown to throw snowballs at.
For many it's their first experience of snow.
They enjoy themselves in the age-old way and the J.C. should feel well rewarded for organising this trip.
Outwardly they seem just like kids everywhere, yet these children are from the Kelston School for the Death.
Many are stone death and live in a world of silence.
At the school they're taught to lip read and to speak, and they become amazingly proficient.
So good in fact that it's hard to realize they can't hear.
When they leave school, they'll be able to live near to normal lives. The weekend soon flits by, but the children certainly won't forget their visit to the shadow.
In Malaya, the president of the Selangor Badminton Association, followed by the New Zealand High Commissioner Mr. Bennett,
welcomes the New Zealand badminton team.
The team meets the chief minister of Malaya, Mr. Mentri Beza.
In the singles match, it's Tanguyke B playing against Miss Sonia Cox of Wellington. Tangite B wins the match for Malaya with a score of 11-2.
For the doubles it's Heather Robson and Val Gau both of Auckland against Malaya's
Jean Moe and Rosie Lowe.
The Malayan girls are fast and agile and their risk work is outstanding.
The Malayan chief minister and his wife see the final set and some first-class badminton.
The New Zealand girls are on their way home from the States after coming third in world tournaments.
They find the heat trying, but their greater experience is an advantage.
The Malayan women have only recently taken up badminton, but the pace their setting is world-class.
The set ends with a win for New Zealand, 4'3. I'm Amorato de Marina
A woman, a girl, ma'amara
Ma carina
But she don't know
She knows of my mother Theean of my mother
For sabarotel, don'tquista
of the world
Marina, Marina,
Marina
Oh, Marita
And I want to
more presto
to scosal
Marina, Marina, Marina,
Marina
and Marina and I want to Marina, Marina, Marina, Marina, Oh, Marina, I'm more
I'm more soo's a woman.
Oh, my be a laura,
no, no, me alessare,
no, no no no, no, no.
Oh no, no, no, no.
Hey!
Hey,
Riva, riva!
I've been in love with a girl that called Marina.
A barina, my little girl! The day we let she kiss and run away.
Why did you have to run away?
My heart keeps trying, please go track to Marina.
Are you still a little senorita?
I need your love, please marry me someday.
Won't you have been a mora? No, long down to al-a-lisade. Please marry me someday Oh, yeah, Bella Mora
Long don't know
Dallasade, don't me
every of bengarde
Oh no, no, no, no, no
Oh no, no, no, no, no, no, no,
Oh, no, no, no, no, no.
Granada, I'm falling under your spell.
And if you would speak, what a fascinating tale you would tell.
Of an age, the world has long forgotten.
Over an age that weaves a silent magic in Grenada today. today The don't in the sky
greets the sky greets the day
with a cypho granada
I still can't remember the splendor that once was
Grenada
It still can be found in the hills all around as I wander along
Entranced by the beauty before me
Entranced by a land full of sunshine and a song.
And one day is done and the sun starts to set in Granada.
I envy the blush of the snow-clad Sierra Nevada.
For soon it will welcome the stars, while a million guitars play soft carbonator.
And the moonlit granada will live again the glories of yesterday
Romantic
and good
There'll be blue batte.
There'll be blue birds over
The white cliffs of the world
Tomorrow
Just you wait and see
There'll be blue
They'll be blue birds of white
The white soap, just you wait and see
Just you wait and see
There'll be love
They'll be loving, love and peace
And ever and tomorrow
When the world is free When the world is free Love and Lankan, peace and ever and tomorrow.
When the world is free.
When the world is free,
the shepherps will tend to sheen, and the valley will bloom again,
and Johnny will go to sleep, but in his own little room again.
Well, there'll be a bluebird's over White Get there
Tomorrow
Just to wait and stay
And there'll be the love
And a napter
And a peace ever after
Tomorrow
When the world is free
When the world is free
Chapters will tend their cheese
And the valley will bloom again
And yon will gird his sleep
When in his own little room again
Well there'll be
Bluebirds or bluebirds are white

Just you wait and see
Just you wait and see. Just you wait and see.
Baby, just you wait and see.
Oh, baby, just you wait and see.
Oh, baby, just you wait and see.
